About Me
I‚Äôm a genetics student at King‚Äôs College London, passionate about biology, programming, and bits of social contract theory.
I love combining disciplines, whether it‚Äôs using code to explore genetics or using philosophy to understand society.
Outside the lab and code editor, I play the guitar, write fantasy stories, and occasionally attempt to draw things that don‚Äôt look awful. I hope you enjoy exploring my projects, thoughts, and half-grown ideas!
Experience


üß¨ British Society for Research on Ageing + University of Exeter (ongoing)

Current member and grant awardee for the 2025 Summer Studentship Grant
Researching the effects of menopuasal symptoms on postmenopausal health with Mendelian Randomisation at the University of Exeter



üß´ Reproductive Genomics Team, University of Exeter (6 weeks)

Projects


GWASExplorer.com

A free, privacy-focused web tool to visualise GWAS summary statistics:
Zero code required
Flexible formatting support
Automated allele frequency querying (via GNOMAD)
Integrated with GeneCards
All processing in-browser ‚Äî no data is uploaded
‚ö†Ô∏è Not affiliated with the GWAS Explorer by the NCI



Think Pythonically

Learn Python the better way.
Focus on how to think like Python
Avoid rote syntax memorisation
Free and beginner-friendly
Still being improved ‚Äî feedback welcome!



Ideate2D

Make games in Python ‚Äî visually and intuitively.
Ideate2D is a WYSIWYG 2D game engine built on PyGame:
Drag-and-drop scene editor
Generates Python code you can modify
Good for teaching or tinkering
Aimed at accessibility without sacrificing flexibility



Into the Mind

A work-in-progress book weaving together:

Biology
Social contract theory
History


All to understand how we got here ‚Äî and where we‚Äôre going.
